Description: Limestone figure of a bound prisoner, similar to EA 23825 but of larger size. The working of the front exhibits clear planes of chiselling and the facial details are extremely rough. The binding of the arms and legs at the back is more clearly shown. The headdress on this figure lacks the central high ridge.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, Found to the east of the "Qasr" annex, beyond Petrie's chamber 29
Curator's comments: W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 73 § 70, pl. xl, 11, see also p. 53 § 51, p. 54 § 53. This is one of a group of about 30 to 40 similar figures, all found together, of which 5 others are London, BM, EA 23825, 23827 to 23830). See also Oxford, AM, 1887.2496-2497 (2 items); Boston, MFA, 87.810-81 (= RES.87.121-125; 5 items altogether); Liverpool, 3.2.87.8; Bristol, H 1987, H1132 (?)
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 73 § 70, pl. xl, 11, see also p. 53 § 51, p. 54 § 53)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.44, p.57, p.178, pl.20)
